page.title: 18Countryside Centre
page.content: Plans have been made by Islwyn Borough Council to set up a countryside centre near Cwmfelinfach. Their aim is to provide environmental study facilities for schools.The council have bought Ynyshywel Farm and 120 acres of land,much of it deciduous woodland for Â£60,000.The converted farm buildings will provide accomodation for 36 people.A resident warden will organise nature trails and study packs.Mr.Norman Liversuch, assistant planning officer,hopes the centre will be finished by summer 1986 The centre will allow schools,other organisations and individuals to study the farm and environment.Antipollution action has cleaned up the River Sirhowy and a varied river community has evolved.Established deciduous and coniferous woodlands are easily accessible.
